title: Augusta County: William Kinney to Alexander H. H. Stuart, November 30, 1852
summary: Kinney relates to Stuart legal matters in Staunton, the election of "Mr. Toms" to "cashier," the upcoming appointment for "Marshall for the Western District of Virginia." Also asks about rumor he heard that Stuart was contemplating buying a farm near Washington, D. C.
keywords: State Government, Agriculture, African Americans, Slavery, American Civil War
